queries.description: Privileged containers lack essential security restrictions and should be avoided by removing the 'privileged' flag or by changing its value to false

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.securityContext.privileged is unset or false

queries.query_name: Non Kube System Pod With Host Mount
queries.description: A non kube-system workload should not have hostPath mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/var/run' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/var/run' mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/sys' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/sys' mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/lib/modules' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/lib/modules' mounted

queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-mesh}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with wildcard RBAC permissions provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API and should be avoided. The principle of least privilege recommends to specify only the set of needed objects and actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dns-server-target-namespace}}.rules[1].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dns-server-target-namespace}}.rules[1].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dns-server-target-namespace}}.rules[2].resources should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dns-server-target-namespace}}.rules[2].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dns-server-target-namespace}}.rules[2].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dns-server-target-namespace}}.rules[2].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[4].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[4].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dashboard-target-namespace}}.rules[2].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dashboard-target-namespace}}.rules[2].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[3].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[3].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace}}.rules[4].resources should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace}}.rules[4].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace}}.rules[4].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace}}.rules[4].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dashboard-target-namespace}}.rules[2].resources should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-dashboard-target-namespace}}.rules[2].resources uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

queries.description: Container should not share the host process ID namespace

files.expected_value: 'spec.template.spec.hostPID' should be set to false or undefined

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.volumeMounts.name={{lib-modules}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.query_name: Workload Mounting With Sensitive OS Directory
queries.description: Workload is mounting a volume with sensitive OS Directory

files.expected_value: Workload name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/var/run' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/var/run' with hostPath

files.expected_value: Workload name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/lib/modules' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/lib/modules' with hostPath

files.expected_value: Workload name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/sys' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'chaos-daemon' of kind 'DaemonSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/sys' with hostPath

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-mesh}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-mesh}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be defined

queries.description: Containers should not have extra capabilities allowed

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}} has no capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}} has a capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-mesh}}.resources.limits.memory should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.resources.limits.memory should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.resources.limits.memory should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.resources.limits.memory should be defined

queries.description: Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.resources.requests.memory should be defined

queries.description: Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.securityContext.capabilities.drop should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-mesh}}.securityContext.capabilities.drop should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.securityContext.capabilities.drop should be defined

queries.description: The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[2].resources should not include the 'pods/exec' resource

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-target-namespace}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, delete, update, patch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-chaos-controller-manager-control-plane}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-mesh}}.readinessProbe should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dashboard}}.readinessProbe should be defined
metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.readinessProbe should be defined

queries.description: Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

metadata.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.securityContext.seccompProfile.type should be defined

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled

metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{chaos-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests

spec.template.spec.containers.name=chaos-dashboard has CPU limits
spec.template.spec.containers.name=chaos-daemon has resources defined
spec.template.spec.containers.name=chaos-mesh has CPU limits

queries.description: CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

files.expected_value: spec.template.spec.containers.name=chaos-daemon should have resources defined

queries.description: Check if Deployment resources don't have a podAntiAffinity policy, which prevents multiple pods from being scheduled on the same node.

files.expected_value: 'spec.template.spec.affinity' should be set

queries.description: Deployments should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability

files.expected_value: metadata.name=chaos-controller-manager is targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
files.actual_value: metadata.name=chaos-controller-manager is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget

queries.query_name: Image Pull Policy Of The Container Is Not Set To Always
queries.description: Image Pull Policy of the container must be defined and set to Always

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-dns-server}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.imagePullPolicy should be set to 'Always'
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{chaos-daemon}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{chaos-daemon}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}} has a 'LimitRange' policy associated
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{chaos-daemon}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
